title: ICML_2006_119_abs

sentences.text: We investigate the problem of learning to predict moves in the board game of Go from game records of expert players .
In particular , we obtain a probability distribution over legal moves for professional play in a given position .
This distribution has numerous applications in computer Go , including serving as an efficient stand-alone Go player .
It would also be effective as a move selector and move sorter for game tree search and as a training tool for Go players .

Our method has two major components : a -RRB- a pattern extraction scheme for efficiently harvesting patterns of given size and shape from expert game records and b -RRB- a Bayesian learning algorithm -LRB- in two variants -RRB- that learns a distribution over the values of a move given a board position based on the local pattern context .

The system is trained on 181,000 expert games and shows excellent prediction performance as indicated by its ability to perfectly predict the moves made by professional Go players in 34 % of test positions .

summary: We investigate the problem of learning to predict moves in the board game of Go from game records of expert players . In particular , we obtain a probability distribution over legal moves for professional play in a given position . This distribution has numerous applications in computer Go , including serving as an efficient stand-alone Go player . It would also be effective as a move selector and move sorter for game tree search and as a training tool for Go players . Our method has two major components : a -RRB- a pattern extraction scheme for efficiently harvesting patterns of given size and shape from expert game records and b -RRB- a Bayesian learning algorithm -LRB- in two variants -RRB- that learns a distribution over the values of a move given a board position based on the local pattern context . The system is trained on 181,000 expert games and shows excellent prediction performance as indicated by its ability to perfectly predict the moves made by professional Go players in 34 % of test positions .

Predicate-investigate.label: investigate
Predicate-investigate.description: To investigate means to systematically examine or analyze something (the object), typically with a goal of gaining understanding, identifying patterns, or uncovering underlying causes. The subject performs this examination in order to gather information, test hypotheses, and draw conclusions about the nature of the object.

Predicate-obtain.label: obtain
Predicate-obtain.description: To obtain means to acquire or gain possession of something, often through effort or action. It implies that the subject has taken steps to secure or achieve the object, which can be a physical entity, an abstract concept, or even a state of being.

Predicate-has_applications_in.label: has applications in
Predicate-has_applications_in.description: The predicate 'has applications in' indicates a relationship between the subject and object where the subject (e.g. an idea, concept, or technology) has practical uses or implications within the scope defined by the object (e.g. a domain, field, or context).

Predicate-serves_as.label: serves as
Predicate-serves_as.description: The predicate 'serves as' indicates a relationship where the subject represents or functions as the object. It implies that the subject has characteristics, properties, or qualities similar to those of the object, and can be used interchangeably with it.

Predicate-be_effective_as.label: be effective as
Predicate-be_effective_as.description: The predicate 'be effective as' indicates that the subject has the capability or function to achieve a specific purpose or outcome, which is described by the object. In general, it suggests a relationship of equivalence between the subject's abilities and the object's description.

Predicate-is_trained_on.label: is trained on
Predicate-is_trained_on.description: Indicates that a subject has been prepared or instructed using a specific dataset or body of knowledge as its foundation. This predicate suggests a process of learning, refinement, and improvement through exposure to the object, which serves as the source material for the subject.

Predicate-would_be_effective_as.label: would be effective as
Predicate-would_be_effective_as.description: The predicate 'would be effective as' indicates that the subject has the potential to serve or fulfill the purpose described in the object. It suggests a functional relationship between the subject and the object, implying that the subject can successfully accomplish or achieve what is specified by the object.

Predicate-has.label: has
Predicate-has.description: The predicate 'has' indicates possession or association between a subject and an object. It suggests that the subject has some quality, characteristic, or attribute described by the object.

Predicate-would_be_effective_for.label: would be effective for
Predicate-would_be_effective_for.description: The predicate 'would be effective for' indicates that the subject has the potential to achieve or accomplish something beneficial or useful with respect to the object. It suggests a causal relationship between the subject and the object, implying that the subject's existence, properties, or actions would lead to positive outcomes or results in relation to the object.

Predicate-use.label: use
Predicate-use.description: To employ or utilize something for a specific purpose or function.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject concept is a specific instance or subclass of the object concept. It represents an is-a relationship between the two, where the subject is more specialized than the object.
